title: The Dollar Milkshake Theory
speaker: Brent Johnson

theses.claim: Dollar and gold can rise simultaneously — gold rejects all fiat, not just USD
Stablecoins are the modern Eurodollar system — US projects dollar dominance through private sector crypto
Bitcoin is a speculative liquidity play, not a safe haven
US will always fund its deficits because global markets are priced off Treasuries
BRICS is overhyped — US internal policy shifts matter more than external blocs

contrarian_takes: Stablecoins cannibalizing Bitcoin in global south
quotable: Universal high income and social unrest. That's my prediction.

title: Intent Engineering — From Prompting to Organizational AI
speaker: Enterprise AI Panel

theses.claim: Intent engineering (making org values machine-readable) is the next frontier after prompt and context engineering
Mediocre model + great intent infrastructure > frontier model + no alignment
AI succeeding at the wrong thing is worse than AI failing (Klarna case)

contrarian_takes: Organizational alignment beats raw model capability
quotable: The distinction between AI that fails and AI that succeeds at the wrong thing is the most important unsolved problem in enterprise AI.

title: AI, Energy, Robots & The Future
speaker: Elon Musk

theses.claim: Energy is the ultimate currency — future measured in watts, not dollars
The bottleneck is electricity, not chips (the 'chip wall' is a power wall)
AGI by 2028-2029, AI exceeding all humans combined by 2030
Triple exponential for robotics — AI + chips + electromechanical dexterity multiplying
Massive deflation coming — AI productivity exceeds money supply
China may pass 3x US electricity output by 2026

contrarian_takes: Saving for retirement is pointless due to coming deflation
quotable: The limiting factor for the next two years will be the ability to turn chips on.

title: Miami Urbanism, Housing & Infrastructure
speaker: David Martin

theses.claim: Missing middle housing via zoning reform beats subsidized affordable housing
Traffic is Miami's #1 existential threat, not housing costs
Miami's growth is residential-first — execs move for lifestyle, companies follow
Teachers can't afford to live where they work — applies to all essential workers

contrarian_takes: Market-based zoning reform over government subsidies
quotable: We need to improve the salaries of our teachers.

title: Decentralized Finance, AI & The Internet for Money
speaker: Jeff Yan

theses.claim: DeFi must be built before AI becomes the primary economic actor or humans lose governance
11-person teams can run $10B protocols if primitives are right
Permissionless perp markets will capture global price discovery from centralized exchanges
VC token allocation is fundamentally incompatible with decentralization

contrarian_takes: Centralized systems move faster but decentralized wins long-term
quotable: I hope Hyperliquid becomes the internet for money.

title: Dollar Decline, AI Bubble & Tail Risk
speaker: Nassim Taleb

theses.claim: Dollar losing store-of-value status (not transaction status) — central banks moving to gold
AI pioneers will go bankrupt — historical pattern of tech revolutions
1970s-style oil shock is the most underpriced tail risk
Tail risks remain massively underpriced by markets

contrarian_takes: Current AI leaders may not be long-term winners
Dollar declining as store of value despite transaction dominance
quotable: I'm sure someone's going to make a lot of money in AI, but doesn't necessarily have to be these companies.

title: AI, Education & The Future of Human Thinking
speaker: Po-Shen Loh

theses.claim: Math is the last curriculum for generating original ideas — everything else is information retrieval
Kids without constant tech access are MORE creative — boredom is precondition for creativity
Using AI for homework is driving a car for exercise — task done, zero mental fitness
Authenticity and genuine human connection is the only reason to choose a human over AI

contrarian_takes: Competition as motivation is ultimately unsatisfying
quotable: Using AI to do your writing homework is like driving your car one mile for exercise.

title: Tesla Berlin, FSD, Optimus & Future of Work
speaker: Elon Musk

theses.claim: FSD sleep-to-destination technical milestone this year
Netherlands FSD approval March 20 2026
Robot hands (mechanical dexterity) are the hard problem, not AI software
Work becomes optional within 10 years
Legacy auto is headed for extinction

contrarian_takes: Robotics bottleneck is mechanical not software
quotable: Working will be optional. Like long-term, which is 10 years from now or less.

title: Scaling Intelligence, Safety & The AI Tsunami
speaker: Dario Amodei

theses.claim: Intelligence is a chemical reaction: data + compute + model size = intelligence, reliably
No theory for WHY scaling works — empirical recipe without fundamental explanation
Moats are in the application layer (biotech, finserv, regulated industries), not model building
Consciousness may be emergent from sufficiently complex self-reflective systems
AI-driven biotech renaissance — programmable mRNA/peptide therapies
Critical thinking is the #1 skill — distinguishing real from fake

contrarian_takes: CEO voluntarily constraining own power via governance structure
Deliberately losing commercial races for safety
quotable: It is surprising to me that we are, in my view, so close to these models reaching the level of human intelligence.
